etymology.description: semantic 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass; plant") + phonetic 早(早) (zǎo, "early") -> originally refers to 皂(皂) (zào, "acorn") -> borrowed for "grass" sense, replacing 艸(艸)
etymology.interpretation: The character 草(cǎo, "grass") combines the semantic component 艹(艹), representing "grass," with the phonetic component 早(早) which was originally used for "acorn." The phonetic was borrowed to represent the sound for the word "grass." This process shows how the character evolved from its original meaning to its current usage.

examples.chinese: 公园里⾠生长茂盛(公園里艸生長茂盛)，孩子们在上面嬉戏(孩子們在上面嬉戲)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngyuán lǐ cǎo shēngzhǎng màoshèng, háizimen zài shàngmiàn xīxì.
examples.english: Grass grows vigorously in the park, and children play on it.

examples.chinese: 山坡上⾠丛生(山坡上艸叢生)。
examples.english: Grass grows densely on the hillside.
